body.directions: Read each word or phrase in Chinese, and then answer the question that follows.

body.quiz: Which of the following professions is most likely associated with the word presented?
body.correct: Job well done! 肉ròu means “meat,” and it is best handled by a butcher.
body.incorrect: Very close. Listen to the one syllable word carefully and think about its meaning.

body.quiz: Which of the following does not fall in the same category as the word presented?
body.answer: Audio for 教授 jiàoshòu
options: Audio for 鸡肉 jīròu
Audio for 牛肉 niúròu
Audio for 鱼肉 yúròu
body.correct: Awesome job! 猪肉 zhūròu (pork), 鸡肉 jīròu(chicken), 牛肉 niúròu (beef), and 鱼肉 yúròu(fish) are all meats, while教授 jiàoshòu means “professor” —although the pronunciations are quite similar.
body.incorrect: Oops... listen to the audios in the options again, and pay attention to the use of different initials for the second characters.

body.quiz: Which of the following phrases can the word presented best complete?
body.correct: You got it! 和 hé means “and” and can be used to connect two words of the same type such as the pronouns “you” and “I.”
body.incorrect: So close! Please think about the meaning of 和 hé and how it can function in a phrase or sentence.
